alert.note: Alert for Albany; Converse; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 2:16PM MDT until May 27 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Northern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... Central Converse County in east central Wyoming... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 215 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rolling Hills to near Harris Park, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Douglas, Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Glendo, Rolling Hills Estates, Esterbrook, Sibley Peak, Friend Park Campground, Two Moon Campground, Laramie Peak, Esterbrook Campground, Laprele Reservoir, Deer Creek, Glendo Reservoir and Harris Park. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 97 and 167. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
